results.title: Youth club
results.creator_credit: Norman Prouting, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and Verity Films
results.brief_description: An account of the activities of youth organisations in Britain and how they help young people to bridge the gap between school and adult life, told through the story of a boy who is persuaded to join a youth club and who quickly discovers the variety of interests which it has to offer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Prouting, Ronald H. Riley, Film Producers Guild and Verity Films

results.title: Yours truly, Andrea G. Stern
results.brief_description: A ten year old struggles with the problem of sharing her mother with a boyfriend who has just moved into the house. The mother is completely at a loss as to what to do, as what seemed a fine idea to her at first quickly turns sour with resentment and jealousy. The resolution of this conflict is thoroughly realistic, and without a “happily ever after” ending.

results.title: Your study methods
results.brief_description: Effective study methods result from thinking about an asignment, considering its requirements and its purposes and working it through in a systematic way. As pupils apply these principles in a variety of study assignments, we learn the value of planning, organising, materials, note taking, and outlining.

results.title: Your skin
results.creator_credit: Ric Wylam, Unilever Films and World Wide Animation
results.brief_description: A combination of animation and photography is used to describe the skin and its functions in simple terms. Some surprising facts and figures are given. The parts of the skin are shown and its growth explained. The film shows clearly the importance of hygiene in helping the body to resist infection.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ric Wylam, Unilever Films and World Wide Animation

results.title: Your mysterious brain
results.creator_credit: Innes Lloyd, Michael Latham, Glyn Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: With the aid of a six-foot model of a human brain and film sequences of brain cells under the microscope the operation of the brain is explained. Brain cells are seen living, dying and linking themselves in the patterns which make human beings behave the way they do. Includes the filming of German artist Horst Pieter drawing under the influence of LSD.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Innes Lloyd, Michael Latham, Glyn Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Your mouth
results.creator_credit: Charles Smith, Lever Brothers Co. and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Examines many aspects of the development of the human mouth: growth of teeth; the function of gums, tongue, lips, muscles, nerves and periodontal membrane; and the protective function of saliva. Explains the relation of the mouth to the exercise of taste and smell and the process of human speech.

results.title: Your Money (Captioned)
results.brief_description: We all need money, we all use money. In the ever-changing financial climate, it’s becoming more and more important to have a sound understanding of money management. The difference between those of us who achieve their financial goals and those of us who don’t, can be measured in a few simple rules. “Your money” is an easy to understand step by step guide to making better financial decisions.

results.title: Your heritage
results.creator_credit: Cinemakers New York and National Trust for Historic Preservation
results.brief_description: A plea for preservation of historically significant American architecture, this film won the awards for the best TV commercial at the 7th Chicago International Film Festival and the TV Commercials Festival, 1971.
